attributes.action: Stop the implementation of cattle grids in Epping Forest! - Epping Forest Transport Strategy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Essex County Council are proposing a new transport strategy for Epping Forest.

Proposed is - amongst other measures - the implementation of a large number of cattle grids on the Forest's roads. Cattle grids are extremely dangerous and potentially fatal to horses!

Essex County Council is propsing the grids as a 'traffic calming measure' - something that could easily and cost effectively be achieved with the implementation of a speed limit.

There is no evidence that cattle grids are calming traffic - other than at the actual spot of the grid.
There is plenty of evidence as regards to how dangerous cattle grids are to horses and riders.

STOP THE CATTLE GRIDS!

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Stop the implementation of cattle grids in Epping Forest! - Epping Forest Transport Strategy."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page18773


Prime Minister's Office
